EINSTEIN PERSONALIZATION
Create a Targeting Rule

A targeting rule determines who is eligible for a personalization decision and which personalized content to return.

REQUIRED USER PERMISSIONS
USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create a targeting rule:	

Create and Edit Personalization Points

Create and Edit Personalization Decisions

When creating a targeting rule, keep these considerations in mind.

You can use direct attributes, related attributes, segments, or calculated insights when creating a targeting rule.
You must first create the segments or calculated insights that you want to use, before you can apply them to the data graph that you’re using for the personalization point before you can select. A rule has access to all attributes, segments, and calculated insights that are accessible from the data graph.
To define more complex rules, you can add up to 50 targeting conditions on a personalization decision.

To create a targeting rule for a personalization decision:

From the App Launcher, search for and select Personalization Points.
Open the personalization point that you want to create a target rule for.

Click the Related tab.
For the decision that you want to add a targeting rule to, click  and select Edit.

In the Personalization Decision Properties window, click Next.
If you are adding a targeting rule to a personalization point using a static banner with call to action option, click Nextto skip the Personalization Attributes configuration.
In the Targeting Rules window, select either All Conditions Are Met or Any Condition Is Met.
OPTION	DESCRIPTION
All Conditions Are Met	If all conditions are met for a visitor, they’re eligible to receive the personalized content.
Any Condition Is Met	If any one of the conditions is met for a visitor, they’re eligible to receive the personalized content.
Click Add Condition.
Select the resource that you want the condition to use.
Clicking a resource opens a menu extension showing additional options that you can select.
RESOURCE OPTION	DESCRIPTION
Direct Attributes	Attributes on the root object of the data graph.
Related Attributes	Attributes associated with linked objects in the data graph.
Segments	Available segment memberships defined at the root of the data graph.
Calculated Insights	Available calculated insights defined at the root of the data graph.
Configure the operator, values, or dates to define the targeting rule condition.
Save your work.

title: Configuring Targeting Rules for Personalization
